text:
="preserve">Ferrous is an adjective coming from the Latin "ferrum" (iron). One uses this word to indicate the presence of iron, mostly in metallurgy or related industries.
There are also non-ferrous metals, which are metals that have no iron in them at all.
Ferrous can also refer to iron in its +2 oxidation state.
"Ferrous" is also the name of a song by Peter Gabriel.
